Reviews.Title: “Great position but otherwise disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JacquiAb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brilliantly situated, but was very noisy due to gondoliers outside our window, and construction at the other window. You can't get a drink except at breakfast, and it's very impersonal. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great location”
Reviews.Author: Stamsters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Anastasia Hotel last August. We booked via there website and their prices were very reasonable. We stayed for 3 nights and we paid around $130 AUD per night and this included a lovely breakfast with great coffee and also a Taxi out to Murano which was great but we would have appreciated it if they had told us that we had to find our own way back. The staff were extremely friendly and we were even given a room upgrade when we arrived and also a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine. The hotel is in a fantastic location and is within walking distance to everywhere, which really helped us as I was 6 and a half months pregnant at the time. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JulieCfromNB
Reviews.Content: Found a good deal on price on Expedia. Easy to find - we took Vaporetto from the Ferrovia stop (right in front of train station on arrival - ticket booths right at the stop) to San Marco, took a left through San Marco square, and followed the designer shops that run parallel to the canal until you get to the large Gucci store. Take a left through the archway just before the Gucci store, beside the hotel there (this is under the same management- go here if you have issues otherwise just ring the bell at the Hotel Anastasia door), take a right, then a left towards the Westin hotel. Hotel Anastasia is in the same square, on the opposite side. All the hotel staff we met spoke very good English. Push the buzzer and tell them you have a reservation and they will be here right away. The rooms were very nice (small, but all marble bathroom, very clean), although my friend felt the beds were hard, I liked them. Quiet room facing the square, no real noise during the night. Continental breakfast was all we wanted, and fresh. Would recommend to anyone as a lovely little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I am coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Louietraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last June on my own. The staff made me feel so welcomed & the room I stayed in was perfect just like the pictures if not better. Breakfast was such a bonus & very delightful. The location was fantastic so easy to get back to after long days on my feet. The best part was being able to look out on to the little square (I stayed on lvl 3) & could see out to the goldulas on the left & hear them playing their music in the evening. This is a true gem & going to back in October. Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average room, dull breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dane37
Reviews.Content: Nice neighbourhood fairly close to San Marco. Clean, but pretty small room. The elevator beeps, and the rooms are not very soundproof, so other guests in the hall come through loud and clear. The breakfast was served in the small lobby. It was a self-service set of boring bread, ham and cheese, and two types of cerial, milk and yoghurt. The coffee was from an automated machine that actually made great coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely!”
Reviews.Author: maudsters
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this lovely hotel for 3 nights and we were very impressed. The location is great â€“ and not very far from a vaporetto stop (San Marco Vallaresso). When we arrived, we rang the bell at the entrance and the receptionist said over the intercom that sheâ€™d be with us in one minute. She came from the sister hotel next door (Hotel Violino Dâ€™Oro) and was actually with us in less than a minute to check us in. That we had to pop into the other reception with any enquiries did not trouble us at all â€“ you have to walk past the door practically every time you go out. All the staff we came across were brilliant â€“ nothing was too much trouble to make our stay comfortable. We nearly always have to ask for an extra mattress to make beds higher up for my husband to manage and at this hotel they made the whole bed up to a higher level for us (usually we just have one single mattress added â€“ which is perfectly ok â€“ but this was much better!) Our room â€“ no. 305 on the third floor â€“ was beautiful, quite spacious and very comfortable. There was a flat-screen TV, safe and mini-bar in the room. The lovely bathroom had an over-bath shower with plenty of hot water. A bit of â€˜mopping upâ€™ was needed after a shower where the water seeped over the side but I adjusted the shower head so it didnâ€™t happen again. We were blessed with unexpected warm weather during our stay and we had to have the windows open overnight. Unfortunately, we were cursed with an unexpected mosquito in the room! I woke up with bites on my hand and face (I already had a bite on my arm from the previous day â€“ not in the hotel). I called into reception on our way out and asked could they possibly spray the room for us. When we returned later, they had sprayed the room and plugged in a â€˜VAPEâ€™ insect repellent, which did the trick. I had read on a previous review that breakfast was taken at the sister hotel but while we were there (beginning of March) the buffet was set out on the ground floor of the Anastasia. Cereals, juices, yogurts, croissants, cake, bread, preserves, fresh fruit, ham and cheese along with hot drinks from a machine were available. The breakfast suited us just fine. There was free wifi internet access â€“ we just got a code from the main reception, which was good for 24 hours on a log on/log off basis. My husband did comment that it was a very good, fast service. This was our fifth stay in Venice but our first at this hotel. We got a â€˜special offerâ€™ rate when we booked direct with the hotel so we were delighted that everything was so lovely as well as a good price! Without a doubt, we would stay here again and recommend it to others. I notice the hotel address above is given as Piazza San Marco.. the hotel is not actually in the piazza but is only a short walk away (past a dozen or so designer shops).

Reviews.Title: “in the middle of all the action”
Reviews.Author: nealcr
Reviews.Content: location, location, location. clean, well-staffed, but very small rooms, good breakfast and a fabulous price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mateus_de_Castro
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s a nice small hotel. The rooms are great. Comfortable, spacious, clean and with the regular amenities. Could change the shower curtains for doors, but thatÂ´s ok. ItÂ´s right there, close to the best spot in town, the Piazza San Marco. Close to the major attractions. CanÂ´t get better than that. The only real downside is this: they have a "brother hotel", just in front of it. So, to save some bucks, after 4 oÂ´clock in the afternoon (and not before 8 or 9 in the morning), the only desk service comes from the other hotel. So, not only you have to check in or out in the other hotel, but you canÂ´t get any information on your hotel. This is a cheap way to go, but if can overcome that, itÂ´s a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel at the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: devedge
Reviews.Content: If you think you'll get lost in venice, this hotel will make your stay in venice worry free. 3 min. Walk to Piazza San Marco. 2 min. Walk to Louis Vuitton, Chanel (which they have all stocks including the classic ones), Hermes. Near a gondola station and port of San Marco. Aside from that its clean, friendly staff, free wifi and buffet breakfast. Although the hotel small and old but thats the beauty of venice. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Modest but nice”
Reviews.Author: squeakybones
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in November, 2011. It was quiet and clean. The staff was friendly. Rooms are small and it's rather bare bones, but very affordable for Venice (we prefer to spend our $$ on good food than expensive hotels). The best thing about it was the location. It's just off San Marco Square and it's easy to find. Our only complaint was that they serve the worst coffee! It was positively undrinkable, and considering we were in Italy...that's pretty bad. I suggest they dump the coffee vending machine thingy and just get a coffee maker. But other than that, it was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Anastasia, Venice”
Reviews.Author: tvkeg1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel recently. Although only 3 star rated, our room was fabulous - very comfortable - and only a short walk to San Marco Square, Grand Canal and most other attractions on the main island. Reception staff were always very helpful and polite. Would highly recommend this establishment to others. Kaye & Ross Griffiths Australia

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: christie584
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night pre-cruise on Sept 25th. I booked the hotel through booking.com about 9 months in advance for 100euros. I wanted to be in a good location so chose the San Marco area (not thinking I'd be jet lagged and not care where I was for the one night stay!). We took the ATVO bus from the airport to P. Roma for 5euro, then the number 2 vaparetto (fewer stops than the number 1) to San Marco. The hotel's site has a map to print out, but I also wrote down other directions I'd found which were helpful - after getting off the vaparetto, turn left and go over the foot bridge. Take the first right onto calle Vallaresso (Harrys bar will be on your right when you turn), walk straight to the end of the street, turn left and come to a square with the San Moise church on your left. Walk straight over the footbridge and immediately turn left to walk under the portico for the Lisbona Hotel. You'll immediately see signs for the hotel. The rooms were nice and had flat screen tvs. The bathroom was big and had bath gel and soap but no shampoo. Free breakfast was offered at the hotel next door and it offered cereal, yogurt, fruit, breads, meats, coffee, and juices. They also have wifi, but the only thing to note - we asked the first guy at the desk if the hotel had free wifi. He acted like he was pained to do us a huge favor and would give us one hour for free. If you don't log off, the time expires so, in the morning, we had to ask for another password. The man in the morning was super friendly and gave us another password - good for 20hours! Why the first guy was so stingy is beyond me. Overall, it was definitely one of the better hotels I've stayed at in Europe and would stay here again if returning to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great ;location and service”
Reviews.Author: Corinne24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before we embarked on a cruise to the Mediterranean (Norwegian Cruise Line - absolutely perfect) and we loved it. First of all it is 2 minutes away from St. Marks square and vaporetto stop, which makes it really convenient, especially if you're carrying heavy luggage. We found the hotel really easily, because we had a map of it from the hotel website. It was really easy to locate. The room was rather small (but this is very common for Venice - don't expect to find large rooms in hotels, because there simply isn't space for them) but it was exactly what we needed. The bathroom is surprisingly large, with a lot of room, amenities, clean towels. The air conditioning was very good. Also, we received a complimentary bottle of Prosecco wine (0.75 l) and a free trip to Murano, where we visited the glass factory and saw a live show of how Murano glass is turned into great pieces (we saw the man there make a Murano glass horse in 3 minutes - amazing). The breakfast was one of the best I have had with hot and cold food, pastry, cereals, eggs, cheese, ham and other meat assortments, fruit, juice, coffee, tea. Would stay here anytime. We would definitely stay here again because it is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBird81
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel so centrally located and close to St Mark's Square, classy and comfortable. The air con was excellent for the heat. The receptionist was very friendly and spoke English which was a welcome relief after battling through Rome train stations. The breakfast was included with the room and served at their sister hotel downstairs - it was one of the best we had and even included apple strudel! It is near the gondela stop and we could hear the gondeler's singing as they went past and playing music - it was beautiful and added to the atmosphere of Venice. We would definitely stay here again. We were upgraded to a room with a view of the terrace below which was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: colombian Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is very nicely located and the rooms are clean and modern. Our bathroom was awesome and the have good A/C. The breakfast was very good and the staff is courteous. The rooms are a little small for the amount of money we payed. The value to space ratio is not there but I think is is like that all over Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Location makes the difference....you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Markinparadise
Reviews.Content: A VERY well travelled friend put together a great cruise on the Adriatic and we stayed here pre departure. As others have said the Location is without peer. The staff was top notch....even insuring that our group was met by water taxi (two blocks away) she personally left the front desk to escort us to the grand canal to make sure we were taken care of. The rooms are a little tired but ours was clean. I am really fussy about bathrooms and this passed muster with flying colors. We put our luxury dollars into the cruise (Seabourn - stunning to say the least!) so we were not expecting much. We only needed to shower and sleep and this place is just fine. Breakfast - served next door at their sister hotel was substantial. The shopping in Venice is fantastic - save your money for that! Would certainly go back for a one or two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JaxLatino
Reviews.Content: I was scared of staying there after reading some awful reviews. However, we found the hotel to be clean, and ideally located close to the Piazza San Marco, stores, restaurants and the public transportation system (The vaporetto). It is a 3 star hotel. The room was good size (queen bed), clean, and with a bathtub in the bathroom. A welcomed fixture after all other hotels had only showers. I saw in the hotel map that there is a very small guestroom on each floor...and I was happy we did not get that one. The breakfast was OK, a lot of carbs,,,LOL. Plan your trip right,,,if you have to go to the airport, plan to either have plenty of time to take the public transportation system, or to have plenty of cash for the water taxi . The hotel staff was helpful and accurate on giving options. They were courteous and professional. We would stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel - do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: cfossGigHarbor
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights in Venice with our kids 26 and 23 plus their friend 25. We tried to book them in Hotel Violino D'Oro but they were full. We put them in Hotel Anastasia behind ours and they shoved a single bed in so no one walk around the room it was so tight and tiny with little windows up high. Very dark and dreary. The hotel desk had a guy who was so rude. Breakfast is not great either and they don't open the curtains so very dinghy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Two words: Stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: SKapoor2010
Reviews.Content: Ok, first the good bits. Or rather, the only good bit. The location is excellent -- barely minutes from Piazza San Marco, and the vaporetto stop. Now for the rest of it. After staying at Hotel Gea in Rome and Hotel Casci in Florence, this came as a rude shock. On checking in I was greeted by a surly woman behind the desk who appeared really annoyed at being interrupted from whatever it is that she was doing. Any queries were met with the same brand of rude indifference. The hotel not only did NOT offer free wifi unlike the others I have encountered in Italy, it also offered you no help if the wi fi you purchased did not work. The consistently unhelpful response I received was that it is outsourced so we can't help it. A friend was staying at another hotel and wanted to come up to my room to change her tee shirt. The guy at the front desk was shockingly rude to her and treated her like she was a hooker I had hired for the afternoon. The woman serving breakfast looked like she'd rather spit in your cappuccino. And oh yeah, the room even by single room standards was SO tiny that I had bruises from constantly walking into the furniture. All in all, I'd rather never go back to Venice (which incidentally is one of the most beautiful cities I've been to) than stay In Hotel Anastatsia again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mia576
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel and were greeted by a rude staff member upon our arrival. The rooms are very outdated and poorly maintained. Additionally, the hotels emergency fittings were duck-taped to the wall. Although this hotel is in a good location, we would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: ruadh_ruadh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for two nights as part of our trip around Northern Italy. For the location and what we paid, Anastasia was satisfactory. The room was small and I managed to flood the bathroom when I had a shower-the water came out with such force I couldn't contain it with the shower curtain!!! The main thing is it was centrally located. The other down side besides the size of the room was that there was no restaurant in the hotel, we arrived late and struggled to find food so late. Venice seems to shut down at night, very quiet

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & location... but sadly substandard”
Reviews.Author: WhiteGatesNewYork
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positives. The location is delightful - my room (201) overlooked a lovely venetian square. Sunlight always hit the room through the bathroom and bedroom windows creating a lovely atmosphere. I remember waking up one morning with the window half-open and the distant sounds of opera singing wafting in! It was quite special. The staff were also great. Friendly, polite, helpful, warm and welcoming - it was like staying in someones house! They didn't speak a lot of English but enough for us to have a good chat. The locations also good. A five minute stroll from St. Marks Square. Now the negatives. First of all, I was paying nearly $300 a night and for that kind of money the hotel really wasn't up to par. My chief complaints: 1. My room wasn't cleaned for the entire duration of my stay (three nights). They didn't even attempt to enter the room. No sign of housekeeping whatsoever... 2. The room wasn't particularly clean. There wasn't any real attention to detail, for instance - handfuls of other peoples mismatching coat hangers left in the closet, a stained bath tub. 3. No real shower! The bathroom had a full size tub and "wand", ie shower head attached to the taps. But there was no hook to attach the shower head to the wall. 4. A VERY small TV - it was smaller than my laptop screen. 5. Breakfast ended at 9:30 which I thought was a bit early. 6. Internet access was available but it was quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Golf_World_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Originally booked for 2 nights but I really enjoyed Venice and this hotel is excellent. The staff were all nice and helpful. I booked a single room - it's kind of small but you have to expect that from Venice. More importantly, it's clean. The breakfast is pretty basic but will fill you up in the morning. This hotel is located centrally - it's near San Marco square but amazingly enough, it's pretty quiet. I slept very well for three nights. The hotel is tucked in away from the main streets - will be hard to find therefore, ask for directions in advance. My google map in my phone didn't direct me exactly to this location. Definitely recommend this for those looking for a nice hotel at a nice price. We all know how expensive Venice can get!!

Reviews.Title: “A gret little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: EJ_Scotland Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The Anastasia is brilliantly located, close to St Mark's Square but tricky to find the first time. We found it thanks to another reviewer on this site who gave directions - find and follow them. The hotel is smaller than my boyfriend thought it looked on the website, however, it has everything you would need and the staff are helpful and speak English. The rooms vary in size but couldn't be described as spacious, however they are well equipped and my only real gripe would be the lack of lighting and of pillows (no spare pillows in the wardrobe). Breakfast was basic but adequate and, in what is currently an expensive city, this hotel represents very good value and its location means that you can do a lot of sighseeing on foot. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “central location comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: scarbyWales
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights in double room on 2nd floor. Hotel is minutes from St Marks Square and near to vaporetto stop and is off the main street (wasn't that hard to find from directions given on hotel website). Room was comfortable and clean, bathroom with shower was very good. Basic breakfast served in small dining/reception area Staff were all cheerful and helpful. Good central location for walking to all attractions

Reviews.Title: “Good Option in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Travelhomeworkgirl
Reviews.Content: Anastasia Hotel is nice hotel in a good location. It's a bit hard to find. (Thank you to another Trip Advisor reviewer for great directions) The room was small, but non un-typical for Italy. The lift goes to the 3rd floor with a flight of stairs to the top floor. The beds were hard. Keep the windows closed because the mosquitos come in and they are huge. The staff was terrific-really nice and helpful. Thanks especially to Daniele.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a great value”
Reviews.Author: OCBeachgirl1
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find an inexpensive hotel in Venice, let alone in the center of everything. It is located close to St. Marks Square, and made the trip to Venice that much nicer. The staff was wonderful and made me feel at home. I had a single room, which was cozy, but the bathroom seemed just as big! The rooms are immaculately clean. My room came with a small refrig/mini bar, so I was able to keep some items cold. There was also a European Breakfast to start the day with.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located, clean, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: blustar85
Reviews.Content: Hotel Anastasia is within a very short walking distance of Basilica di San Marco and the Doge's Palace as well as a vaparetto station. The hotel isn't very large, has 3 floors and is pretty cozy. The room I stayed in was comfortably-sized for me and spotlessly clean. When I looked around at other hotels in Venice, Hotel Anastasia came up as one of the best values. Breakfast is served in the morning, but I chose to traipse around to the local cafes instead. The only thing to be aware of is that the hotel is a little hard to find because it's around the corner from the main street but a local person in the vicinity was able to point me in the right direction. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that's looking for a centrally-located, reasonably priced place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: gerrybhoy1
Reviews.Content: Literally about 2 minutes walk from St Mark's Square, and about 50 metres from main shopping street - Calle Larga Marzo XXII. Over bridge at Chiesa San Moise then turn left straight away and go under the arch, by the gondola station. In a small courtyard - very quiet for the 5 days we were there. Room and bathroom were small (seems to be a Venice thing !) :-) Room safe was free. Space in fridge for water, etc. Air confitioning was brilliant - our room was like walking in to a fridge after a long day's sightseeing in the heat ! Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was fine - eat as much as you like. As mentioned in previous reviews, the toilet flush was like that on an aircraft ! - no big problem though. Would I go back to this hotel ? Definitely. Go and enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for location and price”
Reviews.Author: Massimo1
Reviews.Content: The Anastasia is on a quiet plaza across from the Westin just off Venice's "high street". It is an unusually low priced place in the best location, minutes from San Marco and the water bus stop. The room I had was a tad small, so I can't talk about the other accomodations. It was comfortable and modestly and tastefully decorated and wasn't burdened with the Venice-kitsch "elegance" so many hotels there go overboard on. It had all the things I needed: elevator, plenty of hot water, aircon, mini bar, and a safe. The room and hotel were neat and clean. Yes, you can hear the gondoliers and tradespeople in the morning --- it's Venice, get over it. You don't hear cars and truck and horns as in any other city. The staff was minimal - just a desk person and a few cleaners. I compliment the desk people on their friendliness and attentiveness. When there was a problem with my reservation, they emailed me immediately, kept it open until I called, and we it immediately over the phone. The breakfast, since so many people seem so unnaturally interested in hotel breakfasts, is just a continental breakfast. I think people should be more concerned with whether the TV remote control is in working order. Mine was worn out - it seems to be the case in many hotels. But that's my only complaint about the Anastasia. A word about Venice: it's smaller than one would think and pretty easy to walk most places. There is virtually no nightlife. Lido has a big, popular beach and it's about 15 minute water bus ride from Venice plus about 10 minutes' walk to the beachside. The water at Lido isn't that clean, however.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel close to the centre”
Reviews.Author: sol644
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 23.00 to find the streets flooded!! After rolling up our jeans we made our way to the hotel, only a few minute walk from St Mark's vaporetta stop. The hotel was well placed and the staff friendly. The room was very clean and the bathroom was well fitted and very clean as well. The room was quite small but perfectly adequate with TV, mini bar and hairdryer. Breakfast was buffet style, simple but well stocked. Information about trips and concerts were readily available. Overall a very pleasant stay for not a lot of money. Thoroughly recommend this hotel. ( The only negative was the noise made by the loud flush of the toilets in adjoining rooms.)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay.”
Reviews.Author: DebraGrantham
Reviews.Content: 1st of all, Please use the directions given on a previous review. Trust me without them you will be lost. The Hotel Anastasia is just a stones throw from St Marks square nestled between Gucci, Prada etc. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a lovely Venitian square next to a waterway. The rooms are clean and have lovely Venitian decorations. The rooms are small but its not a problem. The breakfast is simple but more than enough. Coffee, Tea, Juice. Fresh rolls and croissants, Cereal and muffins. Take my advice fill up at breafast as food/drink prices in Venice are scary. I would recomend the Hotel Anastasia to anyone and would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bonvoyage7
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in an amazing location! At just 5 minutes from St Marc's Square its a great base for exploring Venice. The room was a good size and well appointed with a small fridge. The bathroom was quite large by Italian and European standards. The room and bathroom were very clean and also nicely decorated. Continental breakfast in the morning was quite substantial. One minor complaint was that the bed was a bit hard for my personal preference. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly the right place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gezen_Kedi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Anastasia Hotel at the beginning of June, 2008. The hotel is very very centrally located, when every you need to go to toilet, or need to leave you shopping bags, you can directly come to your room and keep on your tour again :)) The hotel personnel can speak English, and they are very helpful. Rooms are not the biggest I have ever seen but are far better than Parisian rooms. Bathroom is all marble, quite new and large. The hotel building is in a small court, even though the are is very central, location is very silent. The breakfast consists of two kind of cheese, honey, marmalade, croissant, bread, cornflakes, tea, coffee, milk and orange juice, which is better than what most of the hotels offer. Mini bar is also okey, they even have mosquito tablettes in the room :) Most of the hotels do not have elevator in Venice (because they are converted from residences / houses of local people), but Hotel Anastasia does. The hotel is suitable for old people, young couples, couples with children and disables visitors. For me, the most important thing was; our room was directly looking to the court infront of the hotel, therefore we had the chance of direct sunlight and view, most of the hotel rooms in Venice are looking to narrow dark streets and some of them even do not have windows so it is better if you include your request in you reservation. Another hint is; ok cannal view is very nice and romantic, but cannals are extremely noisy.

HotelInfo.Name: Anastasia Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco, 2141, 30124 Venice, Italy
